intro: Helenium stoechadifolium, commonly known as the blue helenium, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, ray-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its blue to violet flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
